main.name: Kunlin Cai
main.bio: I am currently a PhD student in the Electrical and Computer Engineering Department at UCLA. My research interests lie in the security and privacy of emerging technologies, including extended reality (XR) and machine learning.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: PhD student in Electrical and Computer Engineering

researchinterest.title: Research Interest:
researchinterest.description: XR security and privacy, Trustworthy Machine Learning

publication.description: [Usenix Security 2024] Remote Keylogging Attacks in Multi-user VR Applications.
publication.description2: Zihao Su*, Kunlin Cai*, Reuben Beeler, Lukas Dresel, Allan Garcia, Ilya Grishchenko, Yuan Tian, Christopher Kruegel, and Giovanni Vigna

publication.description: [KDD 2024] Where Have You Been? A Study of Privacy Risk for Point-of-Interest Recommendation.
publication.description2: Kunlin Cai, Jinghuai Zhang, Zhiqing Hong, William Shand, Guang Wang, Desheng Zhang, Jianfeng Chi, and Yuan Tian

publication.description: [Jamia Open 2019] Detecting reports of unsafe foods in consumer product reviews.
publication.description2: Adyasha Maharana, Kunlin Cai, Joseph Hellerstein, Yulin Hswen, Michael Munsell, Valentina Staneva, Miki Verma, Cynthia Vint, Derry Wijaya, Elaine O Nsoesie

research.description7: 2023.5: Qualcomm Innovation Fellowship 2023 North America Finalist

work.title: Research Intern
work.description: - Program analysis to detect vulnerabilities and privacy policy violations in VR/Unity applications.

work.title: Undergrad Visiting Student Researcher(Remote)
work.description: - Analyzed the TLS handshake data provided by Cloudflare, looked for repeating nonces caused by bad Random Number Generators (RNGs), and categorized the behaviors of the connections with repeating nonces. (Supervised by Professor Nadia Heninger)

work.title: Undergrad Student Researcher
work.description: - Researched on NLP text classification and sentences generalization with insufficient and imbalance data by adding attention mechanism to LSTM models (Supervised by Professor Derry Wijaya)

work.title: Front End Architecture and Testing Intern
work.description: - Built front end applications for cryptocurrency trading platforms to perform user key management.
work.description2: - Researched and tested for front end cross origin solutions to read and share the key for users saved in cookies.
work.description3: - Tested the tools for Bitcoin transactions built by the team.

work.title: Research Intern in Cloud Native Lab
work.description: - Researched and present on Multiparty-computation (MPC) and privacy techniques used in an open source Federal Learning project – FATE.
work.description2: - Dockerized and Deployed Kubeflow, federal Learning project -- FATE on Kubernetes.
work.description3: - Deployed other machine learning and model serving tools such as Tfserving, Mlflow, OnnxRuntime, and Seldon to work with docker-compose and on Kubernetes.
work.description4: - Developed model management tools with Docker with Docker-compose and on Kubernetes.

work.title: Cybersecurity Platform Department Intern
work.description: - Conducted marketing research and product design for the Security Operations Center(SOC) platform.
work.description2: - Researched on functions of Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) products.
work.description3: - Filled and translated technique documents for security products like firewalls and network traffic management tools.

work.title: Research Intern
work.description: - Conducted marketing research for a gymnastics grading program using computer visions as a client’s agent.
work.description2: - Designed solutions using computer visions techniques and sensors to monitor temperature and damages of machines and communication equipment.
